title: Refining music sample identification with a self-supervised graph neural network
author: Aditya Bhattacharjee (Queen Mary University of London), Ivan Meresman Higgs (Queen Mary University of London), Emmanouil Benetos (Queen Mary University of London), Mark Sandler (Queen Mary University of London), ...
relevance_why: The use of Graph Neural Networks and contrastive learning could enhance Haohe Liu's work in audio quality enhancement and music generation, providing new methods for processing audio data.
background: The task involves recognizing and identifying segments of music recordings that have been reused in different audio works, even after transformations like pitch-shifting and time-stretching.
contribution: This paper introduces a lightweight Graph Neural Network architecture within a contrastive learning framework to improve sample identification in music, achieving a mean average precision (mAP) of 44.2%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with identifying samples subjected to musical modifications and required significant computational resources.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work uses fewer parameters (only 9% of the prior models) while offering comparable performance and an effective two-stage retrieval pipeline.

key_innovation: The combination of a Graph Neural Network with a binary cross-attention classifier for robust sample identification and retrieval refinement.
real_world_impact: This approach could significantly improve automatic music identification systems, benefiting copyright attribution and enabling more efficient music retrieval solutions.
limitations: The model appears less effective with samples that undergo significant time-stretching (>5%), indicating a potential weakness in handling dramatic tempo changes.

new_terms.mean average precision (mAP): **Mean Average Precision (mAP)** is a metric used to evaluate information retrieval systems, summarizing the precision of the retrieved items at multiple cutoff points.
new_terms.graph neural network (GNN): **Graph Neural Network (GNN)** is a type of neural network that operates on graph structures, capturing relationships between nodes (data points) based on their connectivity.
